Report: Howedes to Juventus done
By Football Italia staff

Reports suggest Juventus have a deal for Schalke 04 defender Benedikt Howedes, a €3.5m loan with option to buy for €11.5m.

The German international has been moving closer to a move to Turin over the past few days, but negotiations with his club proved tough.

However, tonight Sky Italia is reporting that a deal has been agreed for a season-long loan worth €3.5m, with an option to buy set at €11.5m.

The deal is expected to be concluded tomorrow, with Howedes taking his medicals on Wednesday.

That should allow Kwadwo Asamoah to complete his €10m move to Galatasaray, as the Bianconeri were ensuring they had a replacement before sanctioning that move.

Howedes is known as a centre-back, but can also play at left-back.

Juventus are reportedly not giving up on Kevin Strootman, offering Roma a total €45m.

The Bianconeri have been repeatedly linked with the Dutch midfielder this season, but understandably the Lupi are not keen to sell.

Despite that, calciomercato.com reports that the Old Lady will push to sign him until the last minute of the transfer window, and they’re prepared to raise their offer.

The website believes the last offer was around €40m once bonuses are included, and now Juve are prepared to offer €45m, with at least €35m being money up front.

Strootman has a release clause of €45m which isn’t valid until next summer, but the champions see that as the asking price for Strootman.

If the Lupi reject the offer then Juve could increase the bonuses involved, though it’s thought negotiations will be difficult.

Atalanta sporting director Roberto Spagnolo warns Leonardo Spinazzola “there’s a contract to be respected” as he pushes for a Juventus move.

The full-back is on loan from the Bianconeri, who want to bring him back a year early, and yesterday urged the Orobici to let him leave.

“When Spinazzola returns from the national team, he has to return to being available with the desire to get back on track,” Spagnolo cautioned, speaking to Bergamo TV.

“Both the managing director Luca Percassi and the President Antonio Percassi have spoken clearly, and Juventus did too in confirming the player’s stay.

“The lad has to realise there’s a contract to be respected. There’s a minimum of consideration for what he wants, but for us this story has become a problem because we’re the ones being penalised.”

Atalanta sporting director Roberto Spagnolo warns Leonardo Spinazzola “there’s a contract to be respected” as he pushes for a Juventus move.

The full-back is on loan from the Bianconeri, who want to bring him back a year early, and yesterday urged the Orobici to let him leave.

“When Spinazzola returns from the national team, he has to return to being available with the desire to get back on track,” Spagnolo cautioned, speaking to Bergamo TV.

“Both the managing director Luca Percassi and the President Antonio Percassi have spoken clearly, and Juventus did too in confirming the player’s stay.

“The lad has to realise there’s a contract to be respected. There’s a minimum of consideration for what he wants, but for us this story has become a problem because we’re the ones being penalised.”


唔比走

Reports in the UK state that Arsenal defender Shkodran Mustafi is moving closer to a move to Inter.

The Nerazzurri met with intermediaries for the German centre-back last night, as they look to secure a loan move with an option to buy.

Now The Sun is reporting that a deal is very close, as Mustafi has agreed contract terms for the proposed move.

The only stumbling block is the structure of the deal, as the Gunners would like to insert an obligation to buy into the loan deal, rather than an option.

The loan fee in itself would be small, but the Beneamata would pay 100 per cent of Mustafi’s wages for his 12 months in Milan.

The only stumbling block is the structure of the deal, as the Gunners would like to insert an obligation to buy into the loan deal, rather than an option.

The loan fee in itself would be small, but the Beneamata would pay 100 per cent of Mustafi’s wages for his 12 months in Milan.

羅體：尤文追連拿託-山齊士

據《羅馬體育報》報道，祖雲達斯希望在今年夏天引進拜仁慕尼黑的葡萄牙中場連拿託-山齊士。

《世界體育報》在此前曾報道，祖雲達斯希望花費3300萬歐元轉會費引進安祖高美斯，不過巴塞隆拿對這位葡萄牙中場的標價高達5000萬歐元。

《羅馬體育報》表示，由於引進安祖高美斯的難度較大，祖雲達斯可能轉攻連拿託-山齊士。這位葡萄牙小將很可能在今年夏天離開拜仁慕尼黑，不過祖雲達斯需要面對米蘭和利物浦的競爭。

拜仁慕尼黑在去年夏天以3500萬歐元的價格從賓菲加引進了連拿託-山齊士，這位19歲的葡萄牙中場在2016-17賽季代表拜仁慕尼黑征戰了25場比賽，其中僅有9次是首發登場。

消息参考来源: 全尤文

Schick completes Roma medical
By Football Italia staff

Patrik Schick has completed his Roma medical, so he should officially sign in the coming hours.

The Sampdoria striker arrived in the Eternal City last night, having agreed terms on a €40m move to the Giallorossi.

This morning he arrived to take his medicals at Villa Stuart, having already seen a move to Juventus collapse due to a heart inflammation.

However, that condition has passed after he was granted time off to rest, so there are not expected to be any problems.

Schick will now sign his contract with the Lupi, with the transfer expected to be a loan with obligation to buy next summer

羅馬會唔會同我地一樣 好想知

Howedes flies in for Juventus
By Football Italia staff

Benedikt Howedes is expected in Turin this evening, ahead of his medical with Juventus tomorrow.

The Bianconeri have agreed a deal with Schalke 04 for the German international, expected to be a €3.5m loan with an €11.5m option to buy next summer.

According to Sky Italia, Howedes will fly into Turin’s Caselle airport tonight, before undergoing the necessary tests at J-Medical tomorrow.

The 29-year-old has been capped 44 times by his country, and was part of the side which won the 2014 World Cup in Brazil.

The Bianconeri have agreed a deal with Schalke 04 for the German international, expected to be a €3.5m loan with an €11.5m option to buy next summer.

According to Sky Italia, Howedes will fly into Turin’s Caselle airport tonight, before undergoing the necessary tests at J-Medical tomorrow.

The 29-year-old has been capped 44 times by his country, and was part of the side which won the 2014 World Cup in Brazil.

Lazio forward Keita Baldé Diao has arrived in Monte Carlo to take his medicals with Monaco.

The Senegal international has been the subject of interest from Juventus, Inter, Milan and Napoli this summer, but the Ligue 1 side had an offer accepted earlier today.

Now Sky Italia is reporting that Keita has arrived at Monaco’s sports centre to take his medical, after which he can officially join the principality club.

The deal is believed to be worth €30m plus bonuses, a price hugely offset by Kylian Mbappé’s imminent move to Paris Saint-Germain for €145m plus €35m in bonuses.

Schalke: ‘Howedes not done yet’
By Football Italia staff

Despite reports in Italy that Benedikt Howedes would fly in to join Juventus tonight, Schalke 04 say “as yet there’s no agreement”.

It was reported that the centre-back would fly into Turin this evening, before taking his medicals with the Bianconeri tomorrow.

Multiple sources in Italy say a €3.5m loan with an €11.5m option to buy has been agreed, but Schalke’s sporting director says that’s premature.

“In principle, I won’t say anything about negotiations in progress,” Christian Heidel told Deutschen Presse-Agentur.

“What I can is that as yet there’s no agreement.

“The figures of the transfer? The newspapers write a lot of things…”
馬老大條仆街食得屎未?

Roma have officially confirmed the signing of Sampdoria striker Patrik Schick, in a deal worth up to €42m.

The Czech international took his medicals this morning, and has now officially signed on loan with an obligation to buy.

“AS Roma are delighted to confirm the signing of forward Patrik Schick from Sampdoria,” a statement on the Giallorossi’s website confirmed.

“The agreement includes an immediate loan fee of €5 million and, upon the completion of certain sporting objectives, an obligation to make the transfer permanent for a further €9m.

“The terms of the permanent transfer also include various performance-related bonuses, worth up to a maximum of €8m, based on the achievement of certain sporting objectives on the part of both the club and the player.

“Additionally, Sampdoria are entitled to a final payment of €20m in February 2020. Should Schick be sold prior to 1 February 2020, the clubs have agreed that Sampdoria will be entitled to 50 per cent of the eventual transfer fee or €20m – whichever sum is the greater.”

The striker had been due to join Juventus earlier this summer, but the €30.5m deal collapsed after his medical flagged-up a heart problem, which later cleared up.

If all conditions are met, Schick will become the Lupi’s record signing at a total €42m, beating the €36m paid for Gabriel Batistuta in 2001.

However, with inflation taken into account Batigol would still be the most expensive transfer, as his fee is equivalent to €47.9m today, according to Calcio e Finanza.

Barcelona bid €160m for Dybala
By Football Italia staff

Juventus turned down a €160m Barcelona offer for Paulo Dybala, according to the Corriere dello Sport.

It’s transfer deadline day and the Blaugrana have still not adequately replaced Neymar following his €222m move to Paris Saint-Germain.

Liverpool are still holding firm for Philippe Coutinho and Juve are doing the same for Dybala.

Some Spanish papers have suggested over the last 24 hours that La Joya was the target for a last-minute swoop.

The Corriere dello Sport has quantified it in terms of €160m, although other sources point to €115m cash plus €45m in bonuses.

Juve paid just €40m to sign him from Palermo two years ago and the Argentina international has gone from strength to strength.

This season he was granted the iconic Number 10 jersey and scored four goals in two Serie A games so far this term.

He contributed 19 goals and nine assists in 48 competitive matches for Juventus in 2016-17.

Dybala will be part of a new trident attack for Argentina in this week's World Cup qualifiers, partnering Lionel Messi and Inter's Mauro Icardi.

Marotta: 'No more Juventus buys'

Beppe Marotta said Juventus won’t make any major buys after Benedikt Howedes, reassured Leonardo Spinazzola and said Lazio were “lucky” to get €35m for Keita Balde Diao.

“Sami Khedira has a small problem with his knee, but will certainly be available very soon,” the director general told Sky Sport Italia.

“I think Howedes is the final signing, as we are very happy with the squad at Allegri’s disposal, so do not expect any major moves in the final hours of the market.”

Kwadwo Asamoah is eager for a transfer to Galatasaray, but Marotta warned that is unlikely.

“We have always said that if a player wants to be sold, we’ll try to make him happy. Unfortunately, this is not possible because the offer came late in the market and we don’t have the chance to replace him. I am sure when the window closes, Asamoah will focus and get back to being the great player he always has been.”

Asamoah would’ve been allowed to leave had they got Spinazzola, but Atalanta refused to cut the two-year loan deal short.

“Spinazzola loves football, he loves the Juventus academy where he grew up, and wants to achieve the dream of wearing the Bianconeri jersey as a protagonist. This isn’t possible right now because we have an agreement with Atalanta and he will have a future at Juventus, but we do realise he is upset.”

Alejandro ‘Papu’ Gomez posted a message on Instagram regarding someone who had betrayed his faith.

“We did note Gomez’s comments on social media and want to remind him that being a captain requires certain characteristics and responsibilities that he should learn to adopt. He ought to copy Gigi Buffon’s example on how to be a captain,” added Marotta.

Papu Gomez did later remove the Instagram messages, posting a new one insisting there was no reference to Spinazzola and he was talking about someone else in his private life who had lost his confidence.

Keita Balde Diao joined Monaco for €30m plus bonuses, whereas Juventus had offered at most €15m.

“Keita was a great opportunity on the market, but Lazio and their President have a certain strategy and were quite lucky to get the transfer completed for such a consistent sum.

“Patrik Schick was also an opportunity, but not a necessity.”

Juventus are reportedly making one, final push of €25m for Liverpool midfielder Emre Can.

According to La Stampa, Juve are looking to sign a midfielder after losing Claudio Marchisio and Claudio Marchisio to injury.

The newspaper explains the Bianconeri “have Can in hand for next season”, given his contract expires in just a year’s time.

However, they would have offered €25m for the Germany international on transfer-deadline day.

Report: Zappacosta set for Chelsea
By Football Italia staff

Chelsea have reportedly agreed a €25m deal for Torino full-back Davide Zappacosta.

The Blues have been in the market for a right wing-back for Antonio Conte’s 3-4-3 formation, with Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain rejecting a move to Stamford Bridge as he didn’t want to play there.

Now Sky Italia is reporting that a move for Zappacosta is basically done, with the Granata set to receive around €25m [£23m].

The 25-year-old can play at right-back, right wing-back or on the right of midfield, and has been capped four times by Italy.

hijack OK ?

Although the Italians have no intention of chasing a deal in the final hours of deadline day, Marotta revealed that the club are “watching at the window”.

"Emre Can is a great player," Marotta told Calciomercato. "I don't know if he will extend his contract with Liverpool, but we are at the window, watching what happens."

And speaking to Mediaset at the weekend, Marotta insisted that Juventus will attempt to open negotiations with Can in the January transfer window if, by that point, the player’s Anfield future remains undecided.

Can would be free to discuss terms with clubs outside of England from January 2018.

"Can's contract expires in June, which means we can negotiate in January," he said. "I cannot hide how much I like him, but he's a Liverpool player. All we can do is admire him."

Juventus midfielder Matheus Pereira has officially joined Bordeaux on loan with option to buy.

The 19-year-old arrived from Empoli in January after coming up through the Corinthians academy.

He returned to Empoli on loan, but barely featured.

The Brazilian has been loaned to Bordeaux with an option to buy at the end of the season.
